info.title: Rapidata Asset API
info.description: The API for the Rapidata Asset service

post.summary: Compresses an uploaded image and returns the WebP result.
post.description:
Compression metrics are returned in response headers: X-Original-Size, X-Compressed-Size,
 X-Processing-Time-Ms, X-Original-Dimensions, X-Output-Dimensions.

parameters.name: library
parameters.description: The compression library to use.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: The compression quality from 1 to 100.

parameters.name: maxdim
parameters.description: The maximum dimension (width or height) of the output image.

requestBody.description: The image file to compress.

post.summary: Aborts the specified batch upload.
post.description: URLs already processed will not be reverted. Only remaining URLs are prevented from processing.

parameters.name: batchUploadId
parameters.description: The identifier of the batch upload to abort.

post.summary: Creates a batch upload and queues processing for each URL.
post.description: Each URL is processed asynchronously. Use the batch upload status or result endpoints to track progress.

requestBody.description: The list of URLs to include in the batch upload.

get.summary: Gets the full result of a batch upload including all items.

parameters.name: batchUploadId
parameters.description: The identifier of the batch upload to retrieve.

get.summary: Gets aggregated status for one or more batch uploads.

parameters.name: batchUploadIds
parameters.description: The identifiers of the batch uploads to query.

post.summary: Uploads a single asset to S3 and returns the asset details.
post.description:
This endpoint allows uploading a single file to S3 storage with the asset creator.
 The uploaded asset will be stored using the configured S3 settings and a unique filename will be generated.

requestBody.description: The file to upload to S3.

post.summary: Uploads a single asset to S3 and returns the asset details.
post.description:
This endpoint allows uploading a single file to S3 storage with the asset creator.
 The uploaded asset will be stored using the configured S3 settings and a unique filename will be generated.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url of the file to upload to S3.

get.summary: Gets the metadata for an asset by file name.
get.description:
This endpoint retrieves metadata information for an asset stored in S3.
 The metadata includes details such as content type, size, creation date, and custom metadata fields.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of the file to retrieve metadata for.

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the audience to delete.

get.summary: Gets an audience by its Id.

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The id of the audience to get.

patch.summary: Patches an existing audience.

get.summary: Gets the count of users in each state for the specified audience.

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the audience.

post.summary: Pauses the distillation campaign for the specified audience.

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the audience.

get.summary: Queries jobs for the specified audience.

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the audience.

post.summary: Rebuilds the distilling campaign for the specified audience.
post.description:
Recalculates campaign filters and selections based on the audience's current settings
 (demographic filters, exit conditions, etc.).

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the audience.

post.summary: Resumes the distillation campaign for the specified audience.

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the audience.

post.summary: Starts recruiting users for the specified audience.

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the audience.

patch.summary: Updates the boost configuration for the specified audience.

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the audience.

requestBody.description: The boost configuration values to update.

patch.summary: Updates a rapid's validation properties within an audience.

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the audience.

parameters.name: rapidId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the rapid to update.

requestBody.description: The rapid validation properties to update.

get.summary: Queries all available audiences.

post.summary: Creates a new empty audience.
post.description: An audience is a group of users that are trained to solve particular tasks.

get.summary: Queries all rapids for the specified audience.

post.summary: Adds a new rapid to be used to train users for the specified audience.

get.summary: The monitor endpoint is used to monitor the health of the service

parameters.name: request

get.summary: Gets the upload progress of a dataset.

parameters.description: The id of the dataset to get the progress of.

get.summary: Gets a list of all datapoints that failed to upload.
get.description:
A datapoint usually fails to upload when using a deferred upload mechanism such as when providing a URL
 and the URL is not accessible.

parameters.name: datasetId
parameters.description: The id of the dataset to get the failed datapoints of.

parameters.name: page

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items per page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort fields. Prefix with - for descending order (e.g. -created_at).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by name.

parameters.description: Filter by created_at.

get.summary: Queries customers with filtering and pagination.
Queries the clients for the current customer.
get.description:
A client allows a customer to authenticate with the APIs without using their own credentials.
 This is useful for creating service accounts or other automated processes,
 as when using the Rapidata Python SDK.

get.summary: Gets a specific client by its ID.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The ID of the client to retrieve.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The id of the client to delete.

post.summary: Creates a new client for the current customer.

requestBody.description: The model for creating a new client.

post.summary: Registers a new client dynamically.
post.description: The implementation of this method follows the OpenID Connect Dynamic Client Registration.

post.summary:
Creates a pair of read and write keys for a client.
 The write key is used to store the authentication result.
 The read key is used to retrieve the authentication result.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client ID to create the keys for.

get.summary:
Tries to read the bridge token keys for a given read key.
 The read key is used to retrieve the authentication result written by the write key.

parameters.name: readKey
parameters.description: The read key to read the bridge token keys for.

post.summary: Sets the referrer for the current customer.
Signs in a user using a token received from Google One Tap.

requestBody.description: The body of the request containing the id token.

post.summary: Signs a user up to the newsletter.

requestBody.description: The model containing the email of a user and recaptcha token.

post.summary: Unsubscribes a user from the newsletter.

requestBody.description: The model containing the email of a user and recaptcha token.

post.summary: Sends a survey.

get.summary: Returns the pairwise vote matrix for a benchmark.
get.description: The matrix is returned in pandas split format.

parameters.name: benchmarkId
parameters.description: The identifier of the benchmark.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Optional tags to filter the matrix entries.

parameters.name: participantIds
parameters.description: Optional participant identifiers to include in the matrix.

parameters.name: leaderboardIds
parameters.description: Optional leaderboard identifiers to scope the matrix.

parameters.name: useWeightedScoring
parameters.description: Whether to apply weighted scoring to the matrix values.

get.summary: Returns the pairwise vote matrix for a leaderboard.
get.description: The matrix is returned in pandas split format.

parameters.description: The identifier of the leaderboard.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Optional tags to filter the matrix entries.

parameters.name: useWeightedScoring
parameters.description: Whether to apply weighted scoring to the matrix values.

post.summary: Unlocks a newly cloned order.
post.description:
When an order is cloned only the necessary information is copied.
 In order to make changes to the order, it must be unlocked first.
 Unlocking the order will clone the entire dataset and its datapoints.

parameters.description: The id of the order to unlock

post.summary: Submits an order for approval.
post.description:
Once an order is created its order id and dataset id is returned.
 The dataset id can be used to fill the dataset with data points.
 Once submitted, the order will be locked and no further changes can be made.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to submit

requestBody.description: The model containing additional information for the submission.

post.summary: Approves an order that has been submitted for manual approval.
post.description:
An order is submitted for manual approval when the automatic approval process could not automatically
 determine if the order is safe to process.
 Once an order is approved, the pipeline will start processing the order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to approve

parameters.name: orderId

post.summary: Resumes a paused order. Meaning all campaigns in the order will be resumed.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to resume

get.summary: Queries available validation sets based on the provided filter, paging and sorting criteria.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model containing the query parameters.

get.summary: Gets a validation set that is available to the user and best matches the provided parameters.
get.description: This is not a hard filter, instead it is used to find validation sets that have similar characteristics to the provided instruction.

parameters.name: assetType
parameters.description:
The types of assets that the validation set should contain.
 An asset type can be an image, video, audio, text, or any combination of these.
 
 This parameter is a flag, meaning that it can be null or contain multiple values.
 If multiple values are provided, a validation set will be chosen that contains at least one of the specified asset types.

parameters.name: modality
parameters.description:
The rapid modalities that the validation set should contain.
 The modality is the type of rapid such as classify, compare, locate, etc.
 
 This parameter is a flag, meaning that it can be null or contain multiple values.
 If multiple values are provided, a validation set will be chosen that contains at least one of the specified modalities.

parameters.name: promptType
parameters.description:
The prompt types that the validation set should contain.
 A prompt type is the additional information that is presented to the user when solving a rapid.
 For example, a prompt type can be either text or an asset if the context is an image or video.
 
 This parameter is a flag, meaning that it can be null or contain multiple values.
 If multiple values are provided, a validation set will be chosen that contains at least one of the specified prompt types.

parameters.name: instruction
parameters.description:
An instruction that can be used to filter for validation sets that have similar instructions.
 An instruction is a text that is presented to the user when solving a rapid that explains how to solve the rapid.

delete.summary: Gets a validation set by the id.

parameters.name: validationSetId
parameters.description: The id of the validation set to get.

get.summary: Gets a validation set by the id.

get.summary:
Calculates a summary of the results for a simple compare workflow.
 The summary includes the number of times an asset at each index was the winner.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The ID of the workflow to get the summary for.

parameters.name: useUserScore
parameters.description: Whether to use the user score to determine the winner.

get.summary:
Gets the limit most recent or oldest responses for a workflow.
 The responses are not guaranteed to be of any specific rapid.
 Instead, this endpoint returns all responses to any rapid in the workflow.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The ID of the workflow to get the responses for.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of responses to get.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Whether the oldest or most recent responses should be returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the workflow to delete.

BatchUploadStatus.description: The current status of the batch upload.

urls.description: The URLs to download and process.

batchUploadId.description: The identifier of the created batch upload.
The identifier of the batch upload.

totalCount.description: The total number of URLs in the batch.

completedCount.description: The number of URLs that have been successfully processed.

failedCount.description: The number of URLs that failed to process.

items.description: The individual results for each URL in the batch.

totalCount.description: The total number of URLs across all queried batches.

completedCount.description: The number of URLs that have been successfully processed.

failedCount.description: The number of URLs that failed to process.

completedBatches.description: The identifiers of batch uploads that have fully completed.

asset.description: The asset to use for the rapid.

payload.description: The payload to use for the rapid.

truth.description: The ground truth for the rapid.

randomCorrectProbability.description: The probability for an answer to be correct when randomly guessing.

explanation.description: An explanation for the users if they answer the rapid incorrectly.

context.description: An optional textual context that provides additional information to the user about the rapid.

contextAsset.description: An optional asset that provides additional context to the user about the rapid.

featureFlags.description: The feature flags to enable for the rapid.

isCommonSense.description:
Whether this rapid should be treated as commonsense validation.
 When true, incorrect answers are not accepted and the rapid affects global score.
 When null, AI auto-detection will determine if the rapid is common sense (defaults to false initially).
 Defaults to null (AI auto-detection enabled).

AddRapidToAudienceModel.description: The model for adding a validation rapid with asset in JSON body.

name.description: The name to give the newly created audience.

description.description: An optional markdown-supported description of the audience's purpose.

filters.description:
The filters to apply to any orders created for this audience.
 A filter can be used to restrict the audience to a specific subset of users.

minimumUserScore.description: The minimum user score used to determine whether a user can be included in an audience.

minimumSizeForActivation.description: The minimum number of users required for an audience to be activated.

logo.description: An optional logo image for the audience. Must be an existing image asset.

maxDistillingResponses.description:
Maximum responses before user exits the distilling campaign.
 Defaults to 10. Set to null to disable this exit condition.

minDistillingResponses.description:
Minimum responses before the score floor check applies.
 Users need at least this many responses before they can be kicked out for low score.
 Defaults to 3. Set to null to apply score floor check from the first response.

minDistillingScoreFloor.description:
Minimum user score floor - users below this score exit the distilling campaign
 (only after completing MinDistillingResponses).
 Defaults to 0.2. Set to null to disable this exit condition.

isDistillingCampaignSticky.description:
Whether the distilling campaign should be sticky (users stay until filters don't match).
 Defaults to true (Temporary sticky).

maxDistillingSessions.description:
Maximum sessions (rapid retrievals) before user exits the distilling campaign.
 Defaults to null (disabled). Set to a value to enable session-based exit condition.

minDistillingForGlobalBoost.description:
Minimum distilling users before disabling global boost.
 Defaults to 200. Admin-only override.

minGraduatedForDistillingBoost.description:
Minimum graduated users before disabling distilling boost.
 Defaults to 100. Admin-only override.

CreateAudienceRequest.description: The body request to create an audience.

truth.description: The truth for the validation rapid.

explanation.description: The optional explanation that will be shown to the user when answering wrong.

context.description: An optional text context that will be shown to the user.

contextAsset.description: An optional asset that will be used as context to show to the user.

randomCorrectProbability.description: The probability that if the user answers at random that they'll be correct.

isCommonSense.description:
Whether this rapid should be treated as commonsense validation.
 When true, incorrect answers are not accepted and the rapid affects global score.

UpdateAudienceRapidEndpoint_Input.description: Input model for updating an audience rapid.

name.description: The new name to give to this audience.

description.description: The new description for the audience. Supports markdown. Set to null to remove.

filters.description:
The new filters to apply to any orders created for this audience.
 A filter can be used to restrict the audience to a specific subset of users.

logo.description:
The new logo image for the audience. Must be an existing image asset.
 Set to null to remove the logo.

minGraduatedForDistillingBoost.description:
Minimum graduated users before disabling distilling boost.
 When graduated count is below this, KayzenDistillingAudienceId is added to campaign boosting.

minDistillingForGlobalBoost.description:
Minimum distilling users before disabling global boost.
 When distilling count is below this, RequiresGlobalBoost is set to true.

UpdateAudienceRequest.description: The body request to update an audience.

minDistillingForGlobalBoost.description: Minimum number of distilling users required to activate global boost.

minGraduatedForDistillingBoost.description: Minimum number of graduated users required to activate distilling boost.

isManual.description: If the manual overwrite should be applied

isActive.description: If manual is set to true it will overrule the system with this.

ChangeBoostModel.description: The model to update the manual boost status. or putting it back to autopilot.

priority.description: The new priority value for the campaign.

priority.description: The new priority value for the campaign.

context.description: An additional context to show the users when solving the rapid.

sortIndex.description: The sort index represents the order of the datapoint in the dataset

group.description: The group a datapoint belongs to.

transcription.description: For audio or video assets, an optional transcription of the content.

privateMetadata.description: Private metadata for internal tracking. Not displayed to users.

name.description: The name of the ranking flow.

criteria.description: The ranking criteria used to compare items.

validationSetId.description: Optional ID of the validation set to use.

startingElo.description: Initial Elo rating for new items. Defaults to 1200.

kFactor.description: K-factor controlling Elo rating sensitivity. Defaults to 40.

scalingFactor.description: Scaling factor for Elo probability calculation. Defaults to 400.

maxResponses.description: Maximum number of responses per comparison.

minResponses.description: Minimum number of responses per comparison. Defaults to 1.

benchmarkId.description: If a leaderboard should be added to a preexisting benchmark, the benchmark Id can be provided.

benchmarkName.description:
If no BenchmarkId is provided a new benchmark will be created. if no name is supplied the benchmark
 will be called the same as the leaderboard.

name.description: The name of the leaderboard.

instruction.description: The instruction datapoints will be matched up against.

showPrompt.description: Indicates if the prompt is shown on the rapids.

showPromptAsset.description: Whether the prompt asset should be shown on the rapids.

responseBudget.description: Total amount of responses that get collected per run

minResponses.description: The minimum amount of responses that need to be collected per comparison.

isInversed.description: If the results should be inversed, meaning people should select the worse model.

validationSetId.description: The Validation set that should be attached to every run.

audienceId.description:
Optional audience ID. When provided, the leaderboard will target users who have
 graduated from the audience (i.e., users with a score at or above the audience's minimum threshold).
 Cannot be specified together with Filters.

filters.description:
The filters will be applied on every order that is created by this leaderboard.
 Cannot be specified together with AudienceId.

featureFlags.description: Feature flags that will be applied to every order that is created by this leaderboard.

datasetId.description: The dataset id. If not provided, inherits from the previous revision.

referee.description: The referee is used to determine how many votes will be collected.

featureFlags.description: The feature flags are used to enable or disable certain features.

priority.description: The priority is used to prioritize over other orders.

stickyConfig.description: Configuration for sticky campaign behavior. Takes precedence over StickyState if both are provided.

userScoreDimensions.description: The user score dimensions are used to determine the score of the responses from the user.

demographicKeys.description: The demographic keys are used to determine which demographics to store on the responses from the user.

userFilters.description: The user filters are used to restrict the order to only collect votes from a specific demographic.

validationSetId.description:
The validation set id can be changed to point to a specific validation set. if not provided a sane default will be
 used.

selections.description: The selections are used to determine which tasks are shown to a user.

maxIterations.description: The maximum number of times a user is allowed to see the same rapid.
